Valleywag, 2006-2015</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/txn5RMW916Y/r-i-p-valleywag-2006-2015-1750419908</link><description><p class="first-text">Here lies Valleywag, a Silicon Valley gossip and news site launched in 2006 by Gawker Media and decommissioned in 2015. Its editors and writers over the years included Nick Douglas, Nick Denton, Owen Thomas, Ryan Tate, Nitasha Tiku, and Sam Biddle. The site’s archives are maintained here, but no new posts will be published at this page. You can find incisive news and commentary on the personalities and institutions that govern the technology world at <a href="http://gizmodo.com" rel="noopener" target="_blank">Gizmodo</a>.</p><p><a href="http://valleywag.gawker.com/r-i-p-valleywag-2006-2015-1750419908">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">

</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/txn5RMW916Y" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><pubDate>Thu, 31 Dec 2015 17:55:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1750419908</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[John Cook]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://valleywag.gawker.com/r-i-p-valleywag-2006-2015-1750419908</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Twitter Is So Hopelessly White Its Only Black Engineering Boss Just Quit in Protest</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/6lJ_2-Cvve4/twitter-is-so-hopelessly-white-its-only-black-engineeri-1740617917</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--OW3AN9FR--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1504554546004673064.png" /><p class="first-text">Leslie Miley was “the only African-American in [engineering] leadership” at Twitter, a company that employs thousands, and owes much of its success to adoption by non-white users. Then he quit,<a href="https://medium.com/@shaft/thought-on-diversity-part-2-why-diversity-is-difficult-3dfd552fa1f7" rel="noopener" target="_blank"> as he explains in a new blog post</a>, because the company is absolutely brain-dead on race.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/twitter-is-so-hopelessly-white-its-only-black-engineeri-1740617917">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6lJ_2-Cvve4:JzMT_R2fQsM:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6lJ_2-Cvve4:JzMT_R2fQsM:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6lJ_2-Cvve4:JzMT_R2fQsM:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=6lJ_2-Cvve4:JzMT_R2fQsM:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/6lJ_2-Cvve4" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">race</category><category domain="">diversity</category><category domain="">leslie miley</category><category domain="">twitter</category><category domain="">silicon valley</category><pubDate>Wed, 4 Nov 2015 21:40:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1740617917</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Sam Biddle on Gawker, shared by Sam Biddle to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/twitter-is-so-hopelessly-white-its-only-black-engineeri-1740617917</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>The Extremely Shitty Way One Man Learned He'd Been Fired From Twitter</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/KvVYNoMWvR0/the-extremely-shitty-way-one-man-learned-hed-been-fired-1736246456</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--ZBXdR2dq--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1472283812085625515.png" /><p class="first-text"><a href="http://gawker.com/twitter-ceo-offers-employees-a-bold-peek-into-their-job-1736236381#_ga=1.104805120.1652696571.1429540144">This morning, Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey announced he’s laying off 336 employees</a>, but would do so “with the utmost respect for each and every person.” Also this morning, Twitter engineer Bart Teeuwisse woke up, checked his phone, and learned that he’d been laid off through iOS notifications.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/the-extremely-shitty-way-one-man-learned-hed-been-fired-1736246456">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=KvVYNoMWvR0:0TVp3YAcP2s:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=KvVYNoMWvR0:0TVp3YAcP2s:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=KvVYNoMWvR0:0TVp3YAcP2s:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=KvVYNoMWvR0:0TVp3YAcP2s:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/KvVYNoMWvR0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">twitter</category><category domain="">jack dorsey</category><category domain="">layoffs</category><pubDate>Tue, 13 Oct 2015 15:20:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1736246456</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Sam Biddle on Gawker, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/the-extremely-shitty-way-one-man-learned-hed-been-fired-1736246456</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Twitter CEO Offers Employees a Bold Peek Into Their Jobless Futures</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/O-sUPIBK9K0/twitter-ceo-offers-employees-a-bold-peek-into-their-job-1736236381</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--PDRg0Dfn--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1472257630963599280.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Twitter plans to lay off eight percent of its workforce, the <a href="http://gawker.com/silicon-valley-trend-watch-growing-a-beard-to-mask-pur-1729378729">bearded Machiavellian</a>
 <inset id="1729378729" /> at its helm <a href="http://www.businessinsider.com/jack-dorseys-layoff-letter-to-twitters-staff-2015-10?r=UK&amp;IR=T" rel="noopener" target="_blank">announced in a memo to the company today</a>. Those 336 workers who will be going home without their jobs can at least take comfort in the fact that when Jack Dorsey cut them loose, Jack didn’t beat around the bush. Jack gave it to them straight, baby.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/twitter-ceo-offers-employees-a-bold-peek-into-their-job-1736236381">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=O-sUPIBK9K0:stw4qRqMnP8:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=O-sUPIBK9K0:stw4qRqMnP8:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=O-sUPIBK9K0:stw4qRqMnP8:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=O-sUPIBK9K0:stw4qRqMnP8:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/O-sUPIBK9K0" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">poetry</category><category domain="">twitter</category><category domain="">jack dorsey</category><pubDate>Tue, 13 Oct 2015 14:41:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1736236381</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Andy Cush on Gawker, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/twitter-ceo-offers-employees-a-bold-peek-into-their-job-1736236381</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>White People Control All the Power in Silicon Valley</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/olE_sb43AQs/white-people-control-all-the-power-in-silicon-valley-1735006694</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Hfe20xKZ--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1462360345565764389.jpg" /><p class="first-text"><a href="https://www.theinformation.com/introducing-the-informations-future-list" rel="noopener" target="_blank">A new report finds that Silicon Valley’s power structure</a>, the conduits that determine which technologies will shape the fabric of society, is comprised of a representative mix of the people who use them. Ha ha, of course not, ha ha.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/white-people-control-all-the-power-in-silicon-valley-1735006694">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=olE_sb43AQs:ixyN6cuHnAs:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=olE_sb43AQs:ixyN6cuHnAs:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=olE_sb43AQs:ixyN6cuHnAs:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=olE_sb43AQs:ixyN6cuHnAs:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/olE_sb43AQs" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">diversity</category><category domain="">silicon valley</category><category domain="">ventura capital</category><pubDate>Tue, 6 Oct 2015 19:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1735006694</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Sam Biddle on Gawker, shared by Sam Biddle to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/white-people-control-all-the-power-in-silicon-valley-1735006694</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>A Strike May Park San Francisco's Tech Buses</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/lLByoO4KP3c/a-strike-may-park-san-franciscos-tech-buses-1734571754</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Aehbq3UY--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1459375185189331748.png" /><p class="first-text">San Francisco’s tech workers may be looking for a new ride to work if their shuttle bus drivers go on strike over contract negotiations. At a meeting yesterday in San Leandro, leaders of the Teamsters Local 853 advised members to be prepared for a strike if there’s no progress on the contract proposal that the union approved and sent to Compass Transportation back in August. The proposal would increase pay and improve benefits for drivers.</p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/a-strike-may-park-san-franciscos-tech-buses-1734571754">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=lLByoO4KP3c:lz1Mw6Rmnjk:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=lLByoO4KP3c:lz1Mw6Rmnjk:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=lLByoO4KP3c:lz1Mw6Rmnjk:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=lLByoO4KP3c:lz1Mw6Rmnjk:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/lLByoO4KP3c" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">tech buses</category><category domain="">war on tech buses</category><category domain="">san francisco</category><category domain="">apple</category><category domain="">transportation</category><category domain="">urbanism</category><category domain="">cities</category><category domain="">paypal</category><category domain="">ebay</category><category domain="">genentech</category><category domain="">evernote</category><category domain="">yahoo</category><pubDate>Sun, 4 Oct 2015 18:00:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1734571754</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Kiona Smith-Strickland on Gizmodo, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/a-strike-may-park-san-franciscos-tech-buses-1734571754</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Why Apple Decided to Block Ads on the Same Day It Started Pushing a News App</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/6gh7Fak3zhk/why-apple-decided-to-block-ads-on-the-same-day-it-start-1731252095</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--QwdsTdk4--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1436514781900352034.jpg" /><p class="first-text">Well that’s quite a coincidence. The very same day Apple turned its News app into a mandatory blob on your home screen, it also rolled out ad blocking capabilities in iOS 9. </p><p><a href="http://gizmodo.com/why-apple-decided-to-block-ads-on-the-same-day-it-start-1731252095">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6gh7Fak3zhk:f27K5E0QWwM:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6gh7Fak3zhk:f27K5E0QWwM:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=6gh7Fak3zhk:f27K5E0QWwM:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=6gh7Fak3zhk:f27K5E0QWwM:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/6gh7Fak3zhk" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">ios9</category><category domain="">apple</category><category domain="">badvertising</category><category domain="">advertising</category><category domain="">apps</category><category domain="">ad blockers</category><category domain="">news app</category><category domain="">editors picks</category><pubDate>Thu, 17 Sep 2015 18:50:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1731252095</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Annalee Newitz on Gizmodo, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gizmodo.com/why-apple-decided-to-block-ads-on-the-same-day-it-start-1731252095</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Silicon Valley Banded Together To Protect Abusive CEO Before Company's IPO</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/uoqz6yODLAA/silicon-valley-banded-together-to-protect-abusive-ceo-b-1729817856</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--vzMN_lx---/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1424604903401531825.jpg" /><p class="first-text">In April of 2014, Gurbaksh Chahal was fired as the CEO of the tech company RadiumOne, amid fallout from a domestic violence case. Chahal had managed to escape felony charges <a href="http://valleywag.gawker.com/tech-ceo-dodges-felony-charge-despite-horrifying-abuse-1566515135#_ga=1.227545885.1494277917.1433959547" rel="noopener" target="_blank">despite being caught on camera striking his girlfriend over 100 times</a>, according to prosecutors. But before Chahal was axed, <a href="http://www.wsj.com/article_email/radiumone-worked-to-save-ipo-amid-scandal-1441837667-lMyQjAxMTE1NjAxOTMwMzk2Wj" rel="noopener" target="_blank">a new <em>Wall Street Journal </em>report shows</a>, power players in Silicon Valley were working overtime to protect him and his company’s upcoming IPO.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/silicon-valley-banded-together-to-protect-abusive-ceo-b-1729817856">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=uoqz6yODLAA:fZWFiaHdwIM:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=uoqz6yODLAA:fZWFiaHdwIM:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=uoqz6yODLAA:fZWFiaHdwIM:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=uoqz6yODLAA:fZWFiaHdwIM:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/uoqz6yODLAA" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">silicon valley</category><category domain="">radiumone</category><category domain="">gurbaksh chahal</category><pubDate>Thu, 10 Sep 2015 17:58:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1729817856</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Jordan Sargent on Gawker, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/silicon-valley-banded-together-to-protect-abusive-ceo-b-1729817856</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Silicon Valley Trend Watch: Growing a Beard to Mask Pure Evil</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/4H8R-ftpXPI/silicon-valley-trend-watch-growing-a-beard-to-mask-pur-1729378729</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--Y1Q3XVOG--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1422984312753607720.jpg" /><p class="has-media media-medium has-image"><img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--U86q9iXZ--/1422984312753607720.jpg" width="772" height="477" alt="Silicon Valley Trend Watch: Growing a Beard to Mask Pure Evil" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="1422984312753607720" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--U86q9iXZ--/1422984312753607720.jpg" data-format="jpg" firstasset="true" /></p>
<p class="first-text">In a past age, the American robber baron class would combat bad publicity by building a library or calling in the Pinkertons. Today, Silicon Valley’s captains of industry convince people they’re not a horror-show money vampires simply by growing cool beards.</p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/silicon-valley-trend-watch-growing-a-beard-to-mask-pur-1729378729">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=4H8R-ftpXPI:p7fmhinzcVo:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=4H8R-ftpXPI:p7fmhinzcVo:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=4H8R-ftpXPI:p7fmhinzcVo:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=4H8R-ftpXPI:p7fmhinzcVo:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>

 <inset id="1671970191" /> buyout offer from Facebook, which is only <em>not</em> an insane and arrogant decision if you’re going to reap so much profit that you’re eventually worth more than that. Internal financial documents obtained by Gawker show Snapchat was very far from profitable last year.<a x-inset="hidden" href="http://valleywag.gawker.com/confirmed-snapchat-turned-down-more-than-3-billion-la-1671970191" rel="noopener" target="_blank">http://valleywag.gawker.com/confirmed-snap...</a>

Which may be true. But one thing that’s frequently missing from the conversation about its inevitable dominance over virtually every facet of our lives is the answer to a fundamental question: Does it make money? According to internal financial documents obtained by Gawker, the answer is a resounding no. Uber has lost tens of millions of dollars since 2012, and the documents suggest that CEO Travis Kalanick’s boasts about the company’s exponential revenue growth may be overblown.<a x-inset="hidden" href="http://valleywag.gawker.com/let-no-man-leave-this-earth-without-wildly-speculating-1605536508#_ga=1.173005091.1652696571.1429540144" rel="noopener" target="_blank">http://valleywag.gawker.com/let-no-man-lea...</a><a x-inset="hidden" href="http://valleywag.gawker.com/uber-doesnt-give-a-damn-about-jobs-1583417394#_ga=1.173005091.1652696571.1429540144" rel="noopener" target="_blank">http://valleywag.gawker.com/uber-doesnt-gi...</a></p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/here-are-the-internal-documents-that-prove-uber-is-a-mo-1704234157">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">

Former Reddit CEO Unleashes on Founders</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/PpOdo_tDWcE/was-ellen-pao-set-up-former-reddit-ceo-unleashes-on-fo-1717513252</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--2xWWPbGr--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1339080960567658822.jpg" /><p class="has-media media-medium has-image"><img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--m76kWcph--/1339080960567658822.jpg" width="700" height="447" alt="Was Ellen Pao Set Up? Former Reddit CEO Unleashes on Founders" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="1339080960567658822" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--m76kWcph--/1339080960567658822.jpg" data-format="jpg" firstasset="true" /></p>
<p class="first-text">The story so far: Reddit already despised recently ousted CEO Ellen Pao, and the firing of community liaison Victoria Taylor was the final screwup that did her in. But what if the whole time, she was taking the heat for someone else’s mistake?<a x-inset="hidden" href="http://gawker.com/did-reddits-former-ceo-just-reveal-a-long-con-plan-to-1717334704">http://gawker.com/did-reddits-fo...</a>
 <inset id="1717334704" /></p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/was-ellen-pao-set-up-former-reddit-ceo-unleashes-on-fo-1717513252">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
<a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=PpOdo_tDWcE:lO-kl9AgKsg:H0mrP-F8Qgo"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=H0mrP-F8Qgo" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=PpOdo_tDWcE:lO-kl9AgKsg:yIl2AUoC8zA"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?d=yIl2AUoC8zA" border="0"></img></a> <a href="http://feeds.gawker.com/~ff/valleywag/full?a=PpOdo_tDWcE:lO-kl9AgKsg:V_sGLiPBpWU"><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/valleywag/full?i=PpOdo_tDWcE:lO-kl9AgKsg:V_sGLiPBpWU" border="0"></img></a>
</div><img src="http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/valleywag/full/~4/PpOdo_tDWcE" height="1" width="1" alt=""/></description><category domain="">reddit</category><category domain="">ellen pao</category><category domain="">alexis ohanian</category><category domain="">yishan wong</category><category domain="">victoria taylor</category><pubDate>Mon, 13 Jul 2015 17:57:00 GMT</pubDate><guid isPermaLink="false">1717513252</guid><dc:creator><![CDATA[Sam Biddle on Gawker, shared by Jason Parham to Valleywag]]></dc:creator><feedburner:origLink>http://gawker.com/was-ellen-pao-set-up-former-reddit-ceo-unleashes-on-fo-1717513252</feedburner:origLink></item><item><title>Did Reddit's Former CEO Just Reveal a "Long Con" to Sabotage the Site?</title><link>http://feeds.gawker.com/~r/valleywag/full/~3/W8OGJR76oJ8/did-reddits-former-ceo-just-reveal-a-long-con-plan-to-1717334704</link><description><img src="https://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--oc5zPbqY--/c_fit,fl_progressive,q_80,w_636/1337604709236061218.png" /><p class="has-media media-medium has-image"><img src="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--uOn8z-2G--/1337604709236061218.png" width="636" height="358" alt="Did Reddit's Former CEO Just Reveal a &quot;Long Con&quot; to Sabotage the Site?" lazyload="true" data-chomp-id="1337604709236061218" data-asset-url="http://i.kinja-img.com/gawker-media/image/upload/s--uOn8z-2G--/1337604709236061218.png" data-format="png" firstasset="true" /></p>
<p class="first-text">After Reddit’s surrender to white supremacy this week, users and observers alike have been trying to figure out how exactly we got to this nadir. How could something so popular get so much wrong, over and over again? A new post by Reddit’s ex-chief suggests it’s all been an inside job.<a x-inset="hidden" href="http://gawker.com/the-rise-and-fall-of-reddits-ellen-pao-timeline-of-a-t-1717201369">http://gawker.com/the-rise-and-f...</a>
 <inset id="1717201369" /></p><p><a href="http://gawker.com/did-reddits-former-ceo-just-reveal-a-long-con-plan-to-1717334704">Read more...</a></p><div class="feedflare">
